webproxysrvrSSLClientBytesTotalPerSec.description: SSL Client Bytes Total/sec is the sum of SSL Client Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec. This is the total rate for all bytes transferred between the Web Proxy Server and secured Web Proxy clients.

webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesSentPerSec.name: webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesSentPerSec
webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesSentPerSec.description: Socks Client Bytes Sent/sec is the rate at which data is transferred by the Web Proxy Server from Socks clients to connected servers.

webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesReceivedPerS.name: webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesReceivedPerSec
webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesReceivedPerS.description: Socks Client Bytes Received/sec is the rate at which data is transferred by the Web Proxy Server from connected servers to Socks clients.

webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesTotalPerSec.name: webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesTotalPerSec
webproxysrvrSocksClientBytesTotalPerSec.description: Socks Client Bytes Total/sec is the sum of Socks Client Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec. This is the total rate for all bytes transferred between the Web Proxy Server and Socks clients.

webproxysrvrCurrentUsers.name: webproxysrvrCurrentUsers
webproxysrvrCurrentUsers.description: Current Users is the number of users currently connected to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalUsers.name: webproxysrvrTotalUsers
webproxysrvrTotalUsers.description: Total Users is the total number of users that have ever connected to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrMaximumUsers.name: webproxysrvrMaximumUsers
webproxysrvrMaximumUsers.description: Maximum Users is the maximum number of users that have connected to the Web Proxy Server simultaneously.

webproxysrvrFtpRequests.name: webproxysrvrFtpRequests
webproxysrvrFtpRequests.description: Ftp Requests is the number of Ftp requests that have been made to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrGopherRequests.name: webproxysrvrGopherRequests
webproxysrvrGopherRequests.description: Gopher Requests is the number of Gopher requests that have been made to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrHttpRequests.name: webproxysrvrHttpRequests
webproxysrvrHttpRequests.description: Http Requests is the number of Http requests that have been made to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalRequests.name: webproxysrvrTotalRequests
webproxysrvrTotalRequests.description: Total Requests is the total number of requests that have ever been made to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulRequests.name: webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulRequests
webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulRequests.description: Total Successful Requests is the total number of requests that have been successfully processed by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalFailingRequests.name: webproxysrvrTotalFailingRequests
webproxysrvrTotalFailingRequests.description: Total Failing Requests is the total number of requests that have failed to be processed by the Web Proxy Server due to errors. Errors can be the result of the Web Proxy Server failing to locate a requested server URL on the Internet or because the client failed to be authorized access to the requested URL.

webproxysrvrTotalCacheFetches.name: webproxysrvrTotalCacheFetches
webproxysrvrTotalCacheFetches.description: Total Cache Fetches is the total number of requests that have been served by using cached data from the Web Proxy Server cache.

webproxysrvrTotalUpstreamFetches.name: webproxysrvrTotalUpstreamFetches
webproxysrvrTotalUpstreamFetches.description: Total Upstream Fetches is the total number of requests that have been served by using data retrieved from servers on the Internet or from a chained Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrCacheHitRatioPercent.name: webproxysrvrCacheHitRatioPercent
webproxysrvrCacheHitRatioPercent.description: Cache Hit Ratio is the percentage of requests that have been served using cached data out of the total number of requests to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrSitesDenied.name: webproxysrvrSitesDenied
webproxysrvrSitesDenied.description: Sites Denied is the total number of Internet sites to which the Web Proxy Server has denied access.

webproxysrvrSitesGranted.name: webproxysrvrSitesGranted
webproxysrvrSitesGranted.description: Sites Granted is the total number of Internet sites to which the Web Proxy Server has granted access.

webproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries.name: webproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries
webproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries.description: DNS Cache Entries is the current number of DNS domain name entries cached by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrDNSRetrievals.name: webproxysrvrDNSRetrievals
webproxysrvrDNSRetrievals.description: DNS Retrievals is the total number of DNS domain names that have been retrieved by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes.name: webproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes
webproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes.description: DNS Cache Flushes is the total number of times that the DNS domain name cache has been flushed or cleared by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrDNSCacheHits.name: webproxysrvrDNSCacheHits
webproxysrvrDNSCacheHits.description: DNS Cache Hits is the total number of times a DNS domain name was found within the DNS Cache.

webproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent.name: webproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent
webproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent.description: DNS Cache Hits % is the percentage of DNS domain names served from the Web Proxy Server cache, from the total of all DNS entries that have been retrieved by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrHTTPSSessions.name: webproxysrvrHTTPSSessions
webproxysrvrHTTPSSessions.description: HTTPS sessions is the total number of HTTP-secured sessions serviced by the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) tunnel.

webproxysrvrSNEWSSessions.name: webproxysrvrSNEWSSessions
webproxysrvrSNEWSSessions.description: SNEWS sessions is the total number of SNEWS sessions serviced by the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) tunnel.

webproxysrvrUnknownSSLSessions.name: webproxysrvrUnknownSSLSessions
webproxysrvrUnknownSSLSessions.description: Unknown SSL sessions is the total number of unknown Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) sessions serviced by the SSL tunnel.

webproxysrvrTotalSSLSessions.name: webproxysrvrTotalSSLSessions
webproxysrvrTotalSSLSessions.description: Total SSL sessions is the total number of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) sessions serviced by the SSL tunnel.

webproxysrvrSocksSessions.name: webproxysrvrSocksSessions
webproxysrvrSocksSessions.description: Socks sessions is the current number of active sessions between Socks clients and connected servers serviced by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalSocksSessions.name: webproxysrvrTotalSocksSessions
webproxysrvrTotalSocksSessions.description: Total Socks Sessions is the accumulative number of Socks sessions serviced by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulSocksSessions.name: webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulSocksSessions
webproxysrvrTotalSuccessfulSocksSessions.description: Total Successful Socks Sessions is the accumulative number of Socks requests that were successfully serviced by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrTotalFailedSocksSessions.name: webproxysrvrTotalFailedSocksSessions
webproxysrvrTotalFailedSocksSessions.description: Total Failed Socks Sessions is the accumulative number of Socks requests that were were not serviced by the Web Proxy Server because the client did not have the access rights to satisfy the request, or an initial protocol error.

webproxysrvrThreadPoolSize.name: webproxysrvrThreadPoolSize
webproxysrvrThreadPoolSize.description: Thread Pool Size is the number of threads in the thread pool.

webproxysrvrThreadPoolFailures.name: webproxysrvrThreadPoolFailures
webproxysrvrThreadPoolFailures.description: Thread Pool Failures is the number of requests rejected because the thread pool was overcommitted.

webproxysrvrSSLSessionsScavenged.name: webproxysrvrSSLSessionsScavenged
webproxysrvrSSLSessionsScavenged.description: SSL sessions scavenged is the number of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) sessions closed because of idle timeout and excessive SSL demand.

webproxysrvrThreadPoolActiveSessions.name: webproxysrvrThreadPoolActiveSessions
webproxysrvrThreadPoolActiveSessions.description: Thread Pool active sessions is the number of sessions being actively serviced by thread pool threads.

webproxysrvrArrayBytesSentPerSec.name: webproxysrvrArrayBytesSentPerSec
webproxysrvrArrayBytesSentPerSec.description: Array Bytes Sent/sec is the rate at which data bytes are sent by the Web Proxy Server to other proxies within the same array.

webproxysrvrArrayBytesReceivedPerSec.name: webproxysrvrArrayBytesReceivedPerSec
webproxysrvrArrayBytesReceivedPerSec.description: Array Bytes Received/sec is the rate at which data bytes are received by the Web Proxy Server from other Proxies within the same array in response to requests from this Proxy.

webproxysrvrArrayBytesTotalPerSec.name: webproxysrvrArrayBytesTotalPerSec
webproxysrvrArrayBytesTotalPerSec.description: Array Bytes Total/sec is the sum of Array Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec. This is the total rate for all bytes transferred between the Proxy Server and other members of the same array.

webproxysrvrTotalArrayFetches.name: webproxysrvrTotalArrayFetches
webproxysrvrTotalArrayFetches.description: Total Array Fetches is the total number of requests that have been served by requesting the data from another Web Proxy Server within this array.

webproxysrvrReverseBytesSentPerSec.name: webproxysrvrReverseBytesSentPerSec
webproxysrvrReverseBytesSentPerSec.description: Reverse Bytes Sent/sec is the rate at which data bytes are sent by the Web Proxy Server to web publishing servers in response to Reverse Proxy requests.

webproxysrvrReverseBytesReceivedPerSec.name: webproxysrvrReverseBytesReceivedPerSec
webproxysrvrReverseBytesReceivedPerSec.description: Reverse Bytes Received/sec is the rate at which data bytes are received by the Web Proxy Server from web publishing serverse in response Reverse Proxy requests.

webproxysrvrReverseBytesTotalPerSec.name: webproxysrvrReverseBytesTotalPerSec
webproxysrvrReverseBytesTotalPerSec.description: Reverse Bytes Total/sec is the sum of Reverse Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec. This is the total rate for all bytes transferred between the Proxy Server and web publishing servers in response to Reverse Proxy requests.

webproxysrvrTotalReverseFetches.name: webproxysrvrTotalReverseFetches
webproxysrvrTotalReverseFetches.description: Total Reverse Fetches is the total number of Reverse Proxy requests that have been served by requesting the data from web publishing servers.

webproxysrvrRequestsPerSec.name: webproxysrvrRequestsPerSec
webproxysrvrRequestsPerSec.description: Requests/sec is the rate of incoming requests that have been made to the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrFailingRequestsPerSec.name: webproxysrvrFailingRequestsPerSec
webproxysrvrFailingRequestsPerSec.description: Failing Requests/sec is the rate of requests that have completed with some type of error.

winsockproxysrvrSuccessfulDNSResolutions.name: winsockproxysrvrSuccessfulDNSResolutions
winsockproxysrvrSuccessfulDNSResolutions.description: Number of 'gethostbyname' and 'gethostbyaddr' API calls successfully returned. These are calls used to resolve host DNS domain names and IP addresses for WinSock Proxy connections.

winsockproxysrvrFailedDNSResolutions.name: winsockproxysrvrFailedDNSResolutions
winsockproxysrvrFailedDNSResolutions.description: Number of 'gethostbyname' and 'gethostbyaddr' API calls that have failed. These are calls used to resolve host DNS domain names and IP addresses for WinSock Proxy connections.

winsockproxysrvrPendingDNSResolutions.name: winsockproxysrvrPendingDNSResolutions
winsockproxysrvrPendingDNSResolutions.description: Number of 'gethostbyname' and 'gethostbyaddr' API calls pending resolution. These are calls used to resolve host DNS domain names and IP addresses for WinSock Proxy connections.

winsockproxysrvrActiveSessions.name: winsockproxysrvrActiveSessions
winsockproxysrvrActiveSessions.description: The number of active sessions for WinSock Proxy Server.

winsockproxysrvrActiveTCPConnections.name: winsockproxysrvrActiveTCPConnections
winsockproxysrvrActiveTCPConnections.description: The total number of active TCP connections currently passing data. Connections pending or not yet established are counted elsewhere.

winsockproxysrvrActiveUDPConnections.name: winsockproxysrvrActiveUDPConnections
winsockproxysrvrActiveUDPConnections.description: Total number of active UDP connections.

winsockproxysrvrConnectingTCPConnections.name: winsockproxysrvrConnectingTCPConnections
winsockproxysrvrConnectingTCPConnections.description: Total number of TCP connections pending. These are connections awaiting completion between WinSock Proxy Server and remote computers.

winsockproxysrvrBack_ConnectingTCPConnec.name: winsockproxysrvrBack_ConnectingTCPConnections
winsockproxysrvrBack_ConnectingTCPConnec.description: Total number of TCP connections awaiting an inbound 'connect' call to complete. These are connections placed by WinSock Proxy (WSP) to a client after WSP accepts a connection from the Internet on a listening socket.

winsockproxysrvrAcceptingTCPConnections.name: winsockproxysrvrAcceptingTCPConnections
winsockproxysrvrAcceptingTCPConnections.description: Number of connection objects that wait for TCP connection from WinSock Proxy clients.

winsockproxysrvrListeningTCPConnections.name: winsockproxysrvrListeningTCPConnections
winsockproxysrvrListeningTCPConnections.description: Number of connection objects that wait for TCP connections from remote Internet computers.

winsockproxysrvrWorkerThreads.name: winsockproxysrvrWorkerThreads
winsockproxysrvrWorkerThreads.description: The number of WinSock Proxy worker threads that are currently alive.

winsockproxysrvrAvailableWorkerThreads.name: winsockproxysrvrAvailableWorkerThreads
winsockproxysrvrAvailableWorkerThreads.description: The number of WinSock Proxy worker threads that are available (waiting in completion port queue).

winsockproxysrvrBytesReadPerSec.name: winsockproxysrvrBytesReadPerSec
winsockproxysrvrBytesReadPerSec.description: Number of bytes read by the data-pump per second.

winsockproxysrvrBytesWrittenPerSec.name: winsockproxysrvrBytesWrittenPerSec
winsockproxysrvrBytesWrittenPerSec.description: Number of bytes written by data-pump per second.

winsockproxysrvrNon_connectedUDPMappings.name: winsockproxysrvrNon_connectedUDPMappings
winsockproxysrvrNon_connectedUDPMappings.description: The number of mappings available for UDP connections.

winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries.name: winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries
winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheEntries.description: DNS Cache Entries is the current number of DNS domain name entries cached by the Web Proxy Server.

winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHits.name: winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHits
winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHits.description: DNS Cache Hits is the total number of times a DNS domain name was found within the DNS Cache.

winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes.name: winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes
winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheFlushes.description: DNS Cache Flushes is the total number of times that the DNS domain name cache has been flushed or cleared by the Web Proxy Server.

winsockproxysrvrDNSRetrievals.name: winsockproxysrvrDNSRetrievals
winsockproxysrvrDNSRetrievals.description: DNS Retrievals is the total number of DNS domain names that have been retrieved by the Web Proxy Server.

winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent.name: winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent
winsockproxysrvrDNSCacheHitsPercent.description: DNS Cache Hits % is the percentage of DNS domain names served from the Web Proxy Server cache, from the total of all DNS entries that have been retrieved by the Web Proxy Server.

webproxysrvrcacheURLsInCache.name: webproxysrvrcacheURLsInCache
webproxysrvrcacheURLsInCache.description: URLs in Cache is the current number of URLs in the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheBytesInCache.name: webproxysrvrcacheBytesInCache
webproxysrvrcacheBytesInCache.description: Bytes in Cache is the total number of bytes currently contained in the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesCached.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesCached
webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesCached.description: Total Bytes Cached is the cumulative number of bytes that have been placed into the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesRetrieved.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesRetrieved
webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesRetrieved.description: Total Bytes Retrieved is the cumulative number of bytes that have been retrieved from the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsCached.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsCached
webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsCached.description: Total URLs Cached is the cumulative number of URLs that have been stored into the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsRetrieved.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsRetrieved
webproxysrvrcacheTotalURLsRetrieved.description: Total URLs Retrieved is the cumulative number of URLs that have been retrieved from the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheMaxBytesCached.name: webproxysrvrcacheMaxBytesCached
webproxysrvrcacheMaxBytesCached.description: Max Bytes Cached is the maximum number of bytes that have been stored in the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheMaxURLsCached.name: webproxysrvrcacheMaxURLsCached
webproxysrvrcacheMaxURLsCached.description: Max URLs Cached is the maximum number of URLs that have been stored in the URL Cache.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalActivelyRefreshedU.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalActivelyRefreshedURLs
webproxysrvrcacheTotalActivelyRefreshedU.description: Total Actively Refreshed URLs is the cumulative number of popular URLs in the URL cache that have been preemptively refreshed from the Internet.

webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesActivelyRefre.name: webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesActivelyRefreshed
webproxysrvrcacheTotalBytesActivelyRefre.description: Total Bytes Actively Refreshed is the total of bytes that have been retrieved from the Internet to preemptively refresh popular URLs in the URL cache.

webproxysrvrcacheURLRetrieveRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheURLRetrieveRate
webproxysrvrcacheURLRetrieveRate.description: URL Retrieve Rate is the rate at which URLs are retrieved from the URL cache.

webproxysrvrcacheBytesRetrievedRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheBytesRetrievedRate
webproxysrvrcacheBytesRetrievedRate.description: Bytes Retrieved Rate is the rate at which bytes of data are retrieved from the URL cache.

webproxysrvrcacheURLCommitRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheURLCommitRate
webproxysrvrcacheURLCommitRate.description: URL Commit Rate is the rate at which URLs are commited to the URL cache.

webproxysrvrcacheBytesCommitedRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheBytesCommitedRate
webproxysrvrcacheBytesCommitedRate.description: Bytes Commited Rate is the rate at which bytes of data are commited to the URL cache.

webproxysrvrcacheActiveURLRefreshRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheActiveURLRefreshRate
webproxysrvrcacheActiveURLRefreshRate.description: Active URL Refresh Rate is the rate at which popular URLs in the URL cache are preemptively refreshed from the Internet.

webproxysrvrcacheActiveRefreshBytesRate.name: webproxysrvrcacheActiveRefreshBytesRate
webproxysrvrcacheActiveRefreshBytesRate.description: Active Refresh Bytes Rate is the rate at which bytes of data are retrieved from the Internet to preemptively refresh popular URLs in the URL cache.

telephonyLines.name: telephonyLines
telephonyLines.description: The number of telephone lines serviced by this computer.

telephonyTelephoneDevices.name: telephonyTelephoneDevices
telephonyTelephoneDevices.description: The number of telephone devices serviced by this computer.

telephonyActiveLines.name: telephonyActiveLines
telephonyActiveLines.description: The number of telephone lines serviced by this computer that are currently active.

telephonyActiveTelephones.name: telephonyActiveTelephones
telephonyActiveTelephones.description: The number of telephone devices that are currently being monitored.

telephonyOutgoingCallsPerSec.name: telephonyOutgoingCallsPerSec
telephonyOutgoingCallsPerSec.description: The rate of outgoing calls made by this computer.

telephonyIncomingCallsPerSec.name: telephonyIncomingCallsPerSec
telephonyIncomingCallsPerSec.description: The rate of incoming calls answered by this computer.

telephonyClientApps.name: telephonyClientApps
telephonyClientApps.description: The number of applications that are currently using telephony services.

telephonyCurrentOutgoingCalls.name: telephonyCurrentOutgoingCalls
telephonyCurrentOutgoingCalls.description: Current outgoing calls being serviced by this computer.

telephonyCurrentIncomingCalls.name: telephonyCurrentIncomingCalls
telephonyCurrentIncomingCalls.description: Current incoming calls being serviced by this computer.

rasportrAS_PortTable.name: rasportrAS_PortTable
rasportrAS_PortTable.description: A table containing performance information for instances of 'rAS-Port' objects.

rasportrAS_PortEntry.name: rasportrAS_PortEntry
rasportrAS_PortEntry.description: Performance information for one particular instance of 'rAS-Port' object.

rasportBytesTransmitted.name: rasportBytesTransmitted
rasportBytesTransmitted.description: The number of bytes transmitted total for this connection.

rasportBytesReceived.name: rasportBytesReceived
rasportBytesReceived.description: The number of bytes received total for this connection.

rasportFramesTransmitted.name: rasportFramesTransmitted
rasportFramesTransmitted.description: The number of data frames transmitted total for this connection.

rasportFramesReceived.name: rasportFramesReceived
rasportFramesReceived.description: The number of data frames received total for this connection.

rasportPercentCompressionOut.name: rasportPercentCompressionOut
rasportPercentCompressionOut.description: The compression ratio for bytes being transmitted.

rasportPercentCompressionIn.name: rasportPercentCompressionIn
rasportPercentCompressionIn.description: The compression ratio for bytes being received.

rasportCRCErrors.name: rasportCRCErrors
rasportCRCErrors.description: The total number of CRC Errors for this connection. CRC Errors occur when the frame received contains erroneous data.

rasportTimeoutErrors.name: rasportTimeoutErrors
rasportTimeoutErrors.description: The total number of Timeout Errors for this connection. Timeout Errors occur when an expected is not received in time.

rasportSerialOverrunErrors.name: rasportSerialOverrunErrors
rasportSerialOverrunErrors.description: The total number of Serial Overrun Errors for this connection. Serial Overrun Errors occur when the hardware cannot handle the rate at which data is received.

rasportAlignmentErrors.name: rasportAlignmentErrors
rasportAlignmentErrors.description: The total number of Alignment Errors for this connection. Alignment Errors occur when a byte received is different from the byte expected.

rasportBufferOverrunErrors.name: rasportBufferOverrunErrors
rasportBufferOverrunErrors.description: The total number of Buffer Overrun Errors for this connection. Buffer Overrun Errors when the software cannot handle the rate at which data is received.

rasportTotalErrors.name: rasportTotalErrors
rasportTotalErrors.description: The total number of CRC, Timeout, Serial Overrun, Alignment, and Buffer Overrun Errors for this connection.

rasportBytesTransmittedPerSec.name: rasportBytesTransmittedPerSec
rasportBytesTransmittedPerSec.description: The number of bytes transmitted per second.

rasportBytesReceivedPerSec.name: rasportBytesReceivedPerSec
rasportBytesReceivedPerSec.description: The number of bytes received per second.

rasportFramesTransmittedPerSec.name: rasportFramesTransmittedPerSec
rasportFramesTransmittedPerSec.description: The number of frames transmitted per second.

rasportFramesReceivedPerSec.name: rasportFramesReceivedPerSec
rasportFramesReceivedPerSec.description: The number of frames received per second.

rasportTotalErrorsPerSec.name: rasportTotalErrorsPerSec
rasportTotalErrorsPerSec.description: The total number of CRC, Timeout, Serial Overrun, Alignment, and Buffer Overrun Errors per second.

nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSTable.name: nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSTable
nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSTable.description: A table containing performance information for instances of 'nWLink-NetBIOS' objects.

nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSEntry.name: nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSEntry
nwnetbiosnWLink_NetBIOSEntry.description: Performance information for one particular instance of 'nWLink-NetBIOS' object.

nwnetbiosDatagramsPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramsPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramsPerSec.description: Datagrams/sec is the rate that datagrams are processed by the computer. This counter displays the sum of datagrams sent and datagrams received. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosDatagramBytesPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramBytesPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramBytesPerSec.description: Datagram Bytes/sec is the rate that datagram bytes are processed by the computer. This counter is the sum of datagram bytes that are sent as well as received. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosPacketsPerSec.name: nwnetbiosPacketsPerSec
nwnetbiosPacketsPerSec.description: Packets/sec is the rate that packets are processed by the computer. This count is the sum of Packets Sent and Packets Received per second. This counter includes all packets processed: control as well as data packets.

nwnetbiosFramesPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFramesPerSec
nwnetbiosFramesPerSec.description: Frames/sec is the rate that data frames (or packets) are processed by the computer. This counter is the sum of data frames sent and data frames received. This counter only counts those frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFrameBytesPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFrameBytesPerSec
nwnetbiosFrameBytesPerSec.description: Frame Bytes/sec is the rate that data bytes are processed by the computer. This counter is the sum of data frame bytes sent and received. This counter only counts the byte in frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosBytesTotalPerSec.name: nwnetbiosBytesTotalPerSec
nwnetbiosBytesTotalPerSec.description: Bytes Total/sec is the sum of Frame Bytes/sec and Datagram Bytes/sec. This is the total rate of bytes sent to or received from the network by the protocol, but only counts the bytes in frames (i.e., packets) which carry data.

nwnetbiosConnectionsOpen.name: nwnetbiosConnectionsOpen
nwnetbiosConnectionsOpen.description: Connections Open is the number of connections currently open for this protocol. This counter shows the current count only and does not accumulate over time.

nwnetbiosConnectionsNoRetries.name: nwnetbiosConnectionsNoRetries
nwnetbiosConnectionsNoRetries.description: Connections No Retries is the total count of connections that were successfully made on the first try. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosConnectionsWithRetries.name: nwnetbiosConnectionsWithRetries
nwnetbiosConnectionsWithRetries.description: Connections With Retries is the total count of connections that were made after retrying the attempt. A retry occurs when the first connection attempt failed. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosDisconnectsLocal.name: nwnetbiosDisconnectsLocal
nwnetbiosDisconnectsLocal.description: Disconnects Local is the number of session disconnections that were initiated by the local computer. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosDisconnectsRemote.name: nwnetbiosDisconnectsRemote
nwnetbiosDisconnectsRemote.description: Disconnects Remote is the number of session disconnections that were initiated by the remote computer. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresLink.name: nwnetbiosFailuresLink
nwnetbiosFailuresLink.description: Failures Link is the number of connections that were dropped due to a link failure. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresAdapter.name: nwnetbiosFailuresAdapter
nwnetbiosFailuresAdapter.description: Failures Adapter is the number of connections that were dropped due to an adapter failure. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosConnectionSessionTimeouts.name: nwnetbiosConnectionSessionTimeouts
nwnetbiosConnectionSessionTimeouts.description: Connection Session Timeouts is the number of connections that were dropped due to a session timeout. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosConnectionsCanceled.name: nwnetbiosConnectionsCanceled
nwnetbiosConnectionsCanceled.description: Connections Canceled is the number of connections that were canceled. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresResourceRemote.name: nwnetbiosFailuresResourceRemote
nwnetbiosFailuresResourceRemote.description: Failures Resource Remote is the number of connections that failed because of resource problems or shortages on the remote computer. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresResourceLocal.name: nwnetbiosFailuresResourceLocal
nwnetbiosFailuresResourceLocal.description: Failures Resource Local is the number of connections that failed because of resource problems or shortages on the local computer. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresNotFound.name: nwnetbiosFailuresNotFound
nwnetbiosFailuresNotFound.description: Failures Not Found is the number of connection attempts that failed because the remote computer could not be found. This number is an accumulator and shows a running total.

nwnetbiosFailuresNoListen.name: nwnetbiosFailuresNoListen
nwnetbiosFailuresNoListen.description: Failures No Listen is the number of connections that were rejected because the remote computer was not listening for connection requests.

nwnetbiosDatagramsSentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramsSentPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramsSentPerSec.description: Datagrams Sent/sec is the rate that datagrams are sent from the computer. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote computer is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosDatagramBytesSentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramBytesSentPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramBytesSentPerSec.description: Datagram Bytes Sent/sec is the rate that datagram bytes are sent from the computer. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote computer is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosDatagramsReceivedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramsReceivedPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramsReceivedPerSec.description: Datagrams Received/sec is the rate that datagrams are received by the computer. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote computer is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosDatagramBytesReceivedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosDatagramBytesReceivedPerSec
nwnetbiosDatagramBytesReceivedPerSec.description: Datagram Bytes Received/sec is the rate that datagram bytes are received by the computer. A datagram is a connectionless packet whose delivery to a remote computer is not guaranteed.

nwnetbiosPacketsSentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosPacketsSentPerSec
nwnetbiosPacketsSentPerSec.description: Packets Sent/sec is the rate that packets are sent by the computer. This counter counts all packets sent by the computer, i.e. control as well as data packets.

nwnetbiosPacketsReceivedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosPacketsReceivedPerSec
nwnetbiosPacketsReceivedPerSec.description: Packets Received/sec is the rate that packets are received by the computer. This counter counts all packets processed: control as well as data packets.

nwnetbiosFramesSentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFramesSentPerSec
nwnetbiosFramesSentPerSec.description: Frames Sent/sec is the rate that data frames are sent by the computer. This counter only counts the frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFrameBytesSentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFrameBytesSentPerSec
nwnetbiosFrameBytesSentPerSec.description: Frame Bytes Sent/sec is the rate that data bytes are sent by the computer. This counter only counts the bytes in frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFramesReceivedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFramesReceivedPerSec
nwnetbiosFramesReceivedPerSec.description: Frames Received/sec is the rate that data frames are received by the computer. This counter only counts the frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFrameBytesReceivedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFrameBytesReceivedPerSec
nwnetbiosFrameBytesReceivedPerSec.description: Frame Bytes Received/sec is the rate that data bytes are received by the computer. This counter only counts the frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFramesRe_SentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFramesRe_SentPerSec
nwnetbiosFramesRe_SentPerSec.description: Frames Re-Sent/sec is the rate that data frames (packets) are re-sent by the computer. This counter only counts the frames or packets that carry data.

nwnetbiosFrameBytesRe_SentPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFrameBytesRe_SentPerSec
nwnetbiosFrameBytesRe_SentPerSec.description: Frame Bytes Re-Sent/sec is the rate that data bytes are re-sent by the computer. This counter only counts the bytes in frames that carry data.

nwnetbiosFramesRejectedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFramesRejectedPerSec
nwnetbiosFramesRejectedPerSec.description: Frames Rejected/sec is the rate that data frames are rejected. This counter only counts the frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosFrameBytesRejectedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosFrameBytesRejectedPerSec
nwnetbiosFrameBytesRejectedPerSec.description: Frame Bytes Rejected/sec is the rate that data bytes are rejected. This counter only counts the bytes in data frames (packets) that carry data.

nwnetbiosExpirationsResponse.name: nwnetbiosExpirationsResponse
nwnetbiosExpirationsResponse.description: Expirations Response is the count of T1 timer expirations.

nwnetbiosExpirationsAck.name: nwnetbiosExpirationsAck
nwnetbiosExpirationsAck.description: Expirations Ack is the count of T2 timer expirations

nwnetbiosWindowSendMaximum.name: nwnetbiosWindowSendMaximum
nwnetbiosWindowSendMaximum.description: Window Send Maximum is the maximum number of bytes of data that will be sent before waiting for an acknowledgment from the remote computer.

nwnetbiosWindowSendAverage.name: nwnetbiosWindowSendAverage
nwnetbiosWindowSendAverage.description: Window Send Average is the running average number of data bytes that were sent before waiting for an acknowledgment from the remote computer.

nwnetbiosPiggybackAckQueuedPerSec.name: nwnetbiosPiggybackAckQueuedPerSec
nwnetbiosPiggybackAckQueuedPerSec.description: Piggyback Ack Queued/sec is the rate that piggybacked acknowledgments are queued. Piggyback acknowledgments are acknowledgments to received packets that are to be included in the next outgoing packet to the remote computer.

nwnetbiosPiggybackAckTimeouts.name: nwnetbiosPiggybackAckTimeouts
nwnetbiosPiggybackAckTimeouts.description: Piggyback Ack Timeouts is the number of times that a piggyback acknowledgment could not be sent because there was no outgoing packet to the remote on which to piggyback. A piggyback ack is an acknowledgment to a received packet that is sent along in an outgoing data packet to the remote computer. If no outgoing packet is sent within the timeout period, then an ack packet is sent and this counter is incremented.

ntsystemFileReadOperationsPerSec.name: ntsystemFileReadOperationsPerSec
ntsystemFileReadOperationsPerSec.description: File Read Operations/sec is an aggregate of all the file system read operations on the computer.

ntsystemFileWriteOperationsPerSec.name: ntsystemFileWriteOperationsPerSec
ntsystemFileWriteOperationsPerSec.description: File Write Operations/sec is an aggregate of all the file system write operations on the computer.

ntsystemFileControlOperationsPerSec.name: ntsystemFileControlOperationsPerSec
ntsystemFileControlOperationsPerSec.description: File Control Operations/sec is an aggregate of all file system operations that are neither reads nor writes. These operations usually include file system control requests or requests for information about device characteristics or status.

ntsystemFileReadBytesPerSec.name: ntsystemFileReadBytesPerSec
ntsystemFileReadBytesPerSec.description: File Read Bytes/sec is an aggregate of the bytes transferred for all the file system read operations on the computer.

ntsystemFileWriteBytesPerSec.name: ntsystemFileWriteBytesPerSec
ntsystemFileWriteBytesPerSec.description: File Write Bytes/sec is an aggregate of the bytes transferred for all the file system write operations on the computer.

ntsystemFileControlBytesPerSec.name: ntsystemFileControlBytesPerSec
ntsystemFileControlBytesPerSec.description: File Control Bytes/sec is an aggregate of bytes transferred for all file system operations that are neither reads nor writes. These operations usually include file system control requests or requests for information about device characteristics or status.

ntsystemContextSwitchesPerSec.name: ntsystemContextSwitchesPerSec
ntsystemContextSwitchesPerSec.description: Context Switches/sec is the rate of switches from one thread to another. Thread switches can occur either inside of a single process or across processes. A thread switch may be caused either by one thread asking another for information, or by a thread being preempted by another, higher priority thread becoming ready to run. Unlike some early operating systems, Windows NT uses process boundaries for subsystem protection in addition to the traditional protection of User and Privileged modes. These subsystem processes provide additional protection. Therefore, some work done by Windows NT on behalf of an application may appear in other subsystem processes in addition to the Privileged Time in the application. Switching to the subsystem process causes one Context Switch in the application thread. Switching back causes another Context Switch in the subsystem thread.

ntsystemSystemCallsPerSec.name: ntsystemSystemCallsPerSec
ntsystemSystemCallsPerSec.description: Systems Calls/sec is the frequency of calls to Windows NT system service routines. These routines perform all of the basic scheduling and synchronization of activities on the computer, and provide access to non-graphical devices, memory management, and name space management.

ntsystemPercentTotalProcessorTime.name: ntsystemPercentTotalProcessorTime
ntsystemPercentTotalProcessorTime.description: The % Total Processor Time is the average percentage of time that all the processors on the system are busy executing non-idle threads. On a multi-processor system, if all processors are always busy this is 100%, if all processors are 50% busy this is 50% and if 1/4th of the processors are 100% busy this is 25%. It can be viewed as the fraction of the time spent doing useful work. Each processor is assigned an Idle thread in the Idle process which consumes those unproductive processor cycles not used by any other threads.

ntsystemPercentTotalUserTime.name: ntsystemPercentTotalUserTime
ntsystemPercentTotalUserTime.description: The % Total User Time is the average percentage of time spent in User mode by all processors. On a multi-processor system, if all processors are always in User mode this is 100%, if all processors are 50% in User mode this is 50% and if 1/4th of the processors are in User mode this is 25%. Applications execute in User Mode, as do subsystems like the window manager and the graphics engine. Code executing in User Mode cannot damage the integrity of the Windows NT Executive, Kernel, and device drivers. Unlike some early operating systems, Windows NT uses process boundaries for subsystem protection in addition to the traditional protection of User and Privileged modes. These subsystem processes provide additional protection. Therefore, some work done by Windows NT on behalf of an application may appear in other subsystem processes in addition to the Privileged Time in the application process.

ntsystemPercentTotalPrivilegedTime.name: ntsystemPercentTotalPrivilegedTime
ntsystemPercentTotalPrivilegedTime.description: The % Total Privileged Time is the average percentage of time spent in Privileged mode by all processors. On a multi-processor system, if all processors are always in Privileged mode this is 100%, and if 1/4th of the processors are in Privileged mode this is 25%. When a Windows NT system service is called, the service will often run in Privileged Mode in order to gain access to system-private data. Such data is protected from access by threads executing in User Mode. Calls to the system may be explicit, or they may be implicit such as when a page fault or an interrupt occurs. Unlike some early operating systems, Windows NT uses process boundaries for subsystem protection in addition to the traditional protection of User and Privileged modes. These subsystem processes provide additional protection. Therefore, some work done by Windows NT on behalf of an application may appear in other subsystem processes in addition to the Privileged Time in the application process.

ntsystemTotalInterruptsPerSec.name: ntsystemTotalInterruptsPerSec
ntsystemTotalInterruptsPerSec.description: Total Interrupts/sec is the rate the computer is receiving and servicing hardware interrupts. Some devices that may generate interrupts are the system timer, the mouse, data communication lines, network interface cards and other peripheral devices. This counter provides an indication of how busy these devices are on a computer-wide basis. See also Processor:Interrupts/sec.

ntsystemFileDataOperationsPerSec.name: ntsystemFileDataOperationsPerSec
ntsystemFileDataOperationsPerSec.description: File Data Operations per second is the rate that the computer is issuing Read and Write operations to file system devices. It does not include File Control Operations.

ntsystemSystemUpTime.name: ntsystemSystemUpTime
ntsystemSystemUpTime.description: Total Time (in seconds) that the computer has been operational since it was last started.

ntsystemProcessorQueueLength.name: ntsystemProcessorQueueLength
ntsystemProcessorQueueLength.description: Processor Queue Length is the instantaneous length of the processor queue in units of threads. This counter is always 0 unless you are also monitoring a thread counter. All processors use a single queue in which threads wait for processor cycles. This length does not include the threads that are currently executing. A sustained processor queue length greater than two generally indicates processor congestion. This is an instantaneous count, not an average over the time interval.

ntsystemAlignmentFixupsPerSec.name: ntsystemAlignmentFixupsPerSec
ntsystemAlignmentFixupsPerSec.description: Alignment Fixups/sec is the rate of alignment faults fixed by the system.

ntsystemExceptionDispatchesPerSec.name: ntsystemExceptionDispatchesPerSec
ntsystemExceptionDispatchesPerSec.description: Exception Dispatches/sec is the rate of exceptions dispatched by the system.

ntsystemFloatingEmulationsPerSec.name: ntsystemFloatingEmulationsPerSec
ntsystemFloatingEmulationsPerSec.description: Floating Emulations/sec is the rate of floating emulations performed by the system.

ntsystemPercentTotalDPCTime.name: ntsystemPercentTotalDPCTime
ntsystemPercentTotalDPCTime.description: % Total DPC Time is the sum of % DPC Time of all processors divided by the number of processors in the system. (See Processor: % DPC Time for detail.)

ntsystemPercentTotalInterruptTime.name: ntsystemPercentTotalInterruptTime
ntsystemPercentTotalInterruptTime.description: % Total Interrupt Time is the sum of % Interrupt Time of all processors divided by the number of processors in the system. (See Processor: % Interrupt Time for detail.)

ntsystemTotalDPCsQueuedPerSec.name: ntsystemTotalDPCsQueuedPerSec
ntsystemTotalDPCsQueuedPerSec.description: Total DPCs Queued/sec is the rate DPC objects are queued to all processors' DPC queues.

ntsystemTotalDPCRate.name: ntsystemTotalDPCRate
ntsystemTotalDPCRate.description: Total DPC Rate is the average rate DPC objects are queued to all processors' DPC queue per clock tick.

ntsystemTotalDPCBypassesPerSec.name: ntsystemTotalDPCBypassesPerSec
ntsystemTotalDPCBypassesPerSec.description: Total DPC Bypasses/sec is the overall rate Dispatch interrupts were short-circuited across all processors.

ntsystemTotalAPCBypassesPerSec.name: ntsystemTotalAPCBypassesPerSec
ntsystemTotalAPCBypassesPerSec.description: Total APC Bypasses/sec is the overall rate kernel APC interrupts were short-circuited across all processors.

ntsystemPercentRegistryQuotaInUse.name: ntsystemPercentRegistryQuotaInUse
ntsystemPercentRegistryQuotaInUse.description: % Registry Quota In Use indicates the percentage of the Total Registry Quota Allowed currently in use by the system.

packetfilterTotalDroppedFrames.name: packetfilterTotalDroppedFrames
packetfilterTotalDroppedFrames.description: The total number of dropped or filtered frames.

packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToFilterDeni.name: packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToFilterDenial
packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToFilterDeni.description: Total number of frames dropped because dynamic packet filtering did not allow the data.

packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToProtocolVi.name: packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToProtocolViolations
packetfilterFramesDroppedDueToProtocolVi.description: This is the total of the number of frames dropped because of some protocol irregularity.

packetfilterTotalIncomingConnections.name: packetfilterTotalIncomingConnections
packetfilterTotalIncomingConnections.description: This is the total of the number of connections made through the filtered interfaces.

packetfilterTotalLostLoggingFrames.name: packetfilterTotalLostLoggingFrames
packetfilterTotalLostLoggingFrames.description: This is the total of the number of frames dropped that could not be logged.

webserviceweb_ServiceTable.name: webserviceweb_ServiceTable
webserviceweb_ServiceTable.description: A table containing performance information for instances of 'web-Service' objects.

webserviceweb_ServiceEntry.name: webserviceweb_ServiceEntry
webserviceweb_ServiceEntry.description: Performance information for one particular instance of 'web-Service' object.

webserviceBytesSentPerSec.name: webserviceBytesSentPerSec
webserviceBytesSentPerSec.description: Bytes Sent/sec is the rate that data bytes are sent by the Web service.

webserviceBytesReceivedPerSec.name: webserviceBytesReceivedPerSec
webserviceBytesReceivedPerSec.description: Bytes Received/sec is the rate that data bytes are received by the Web service.

webserviceBytesTotalPerSec.name: webserviceBytesTotalPerSec
webserviceBytesTotalPerSec.description: Bytes Total/sec is the sum of Bytes Sent/sec and Bytes Received/sec. This is the total rate of bytes transferred by the Web service.

webserviceTotalFilesSent.name: webserviceTotalFilesSent
webserviceTotalFilesSent.description: Total Files Sent is the total number of files sent by the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceFilesSentPerSec.name: webserviceFilesSentPerSec
webserviceFilesSentPerSec.description: The rate files are sent by the Web service.

webserviceTotalFilesReceived.name: webserviceTotalFilesReceived
webserviceTotalFilesReceived.description: Total Files Received is the total number of files received by the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceFilesReceivedPerSec.name: webserviceFilesReceivedPerSec
webserviceFilesReceivedPerSec.description: The rate files are received by the Web service.

webserviceTotalFilesTransferred.name: webserviceTotalFilesTransferred
webserviceTotalFilesTransferred.description: Total Files Transferred is the sum of Files Sent and Files Received. This is the total number of files transferred by the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceFilesPerSec.name: webserviceFilesPerSec
webserviceFilesPerSec.description: The rate files are transferred, that is, sent and received by the Web service.

webserviceCurrentAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceCurrentAnonymousUsers
webserviceCurrentAnonymousUsers.description: Current Anonymous Users is the number of users who currently have an anonymous connection using the Web service.

webserviceCurrentNonAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceCurrentNonAnonymousUsers
webserviceCurrentNonAnonymousUsers.description: Current NonAnonymous Users is the number of users who currently have a non-anonymous connection using the Web service.

webserviceTotalAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceTotalAnonymousUsers
webserviceTotalAnonymousUsers.description: Total Anonymous Users is the total number of users who established an anonymous connection with the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceAnonymousUsersPerSec.name: webserviceAnonymousUsersPerSec
webserviceAnonymousUsersPerSec.description: The rate users are making anonymous connections using the Web service.

webserviceTotalNonAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceTotalNonAnonymousUsers
webserviceTotalNonAnonymousUsers.description: Total NonAnonymous Users is the total number of users who established a non-anonymous connection with the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceNonAnonymousUsersPerSec.name: webserviceNonAnonymousUsersPerSec
webserviceNonAnonymousUsersPerSec.description: The rate users are making non-anonymous connections using the Web service.

webserviceMaximumAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceMaximumAnonymousUsers
webserviceMaximumAnonymousUsers.description: Maximum Anonymous Users is the maximum number of users who established concurrent anonymous connections using the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceMaximumNonAnonymousUsers.name: webserviceMaximumNonAnonymousUsers
webserviceMaximumNonAnonymousUsers.description: Maximum NonAnonymous Users is the maximum number of users who established concurrent non-anonymous connections using the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceCurrentConnections.name: webserviceCurrentConnections
webserviceCurrentConnections.description: Current Connections is the current number of connections established with the Web service.

webserviceMaximumConnections.name: webserviceMaximumConnections
webserviceMaximumConnections.description: Maximum Connections is the maximum number of simultaneous connections established with the Web service.

webserviceTotalConnectionAttempts.name: webserviceTotalConnectionAttempts
webserviceTotalConnectionAttempts.description: Total Connection Attempts is the number of connections that have been attempted using the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceConnectionAttemptsPerSec.name: webserviceConnectionAttemptsPerSec
webserviceConnectionAttemptsPerSec.description: The rate that connections using the Web service are being attempted.

webserviceTotalLogonAttempts.name: webserviceTotalLogonAttempts
webserviceTotalLogonAttempts.description: Total Logon Attempts is the number of logons that have been attempted using the Web service (counted since service startup).

webserviceLogonAttemptsPerSec.name: webserviceLogonAttemptsPerSec
webserviceLogonAttemptsPerSec.description: The rate that logons using the Web service are being attempted.

webserviceTotalGetRequests.name: webserviceTotalGetRequests
webserviceTotalGetRequests.description: Total Get Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the GET method (counted since service startup). Get requests are generally used for basic file retrievals or image maps, though they can be used with forms.

webserviceGetRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceGetRequestsPerSec
webserviceGetRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using the GET method are made. Get requests are generally used for basic file retrievals or image maps, though they can be used with forms.

webserviceTotalPostRequests.name: webserviceTotalPostRequests
webserviceTotalPostRequests.description: Total Post Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the POST method (counted since service startup). Post requests are generally used for forms or gateway requests.

webservicePostRequestsPerSec.name: webservicePostRequestsPerSec
webservicePostRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using the POST method are made. Post requests are generally used for forms or gateway requests.

webserviceTotalHeadRequests.name: webserviceTotalHeadRequests
webserviceTotalHeadRequests.description: Total Head Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the HEAD method (counted since service startup). Head requests generally indicate a client is querying the state of a document they already have to see if it needs to be refreshed.

webserviceHeadRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceHeadRequestsPerSec
webserviceHeadRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using the HEAD method are made. Head requests generally indicate a client is querying the state of a document they already have to see if it needs to be refreshed.

webserviceTotalPutRequests.name: webserviceTotalPutRequests
webserviceTotalPutRequests.description: Total Put Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the PUT method (counted since service startup).

webservicePutRequestsPerSec.name: webservicePutRequestsPerSec
webservicePutRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using the PUT method are made.

webserviceTotalDeleteRequests.name: webserviceTotalDeleteRequests
webserviceTotalDeleteRequests.description: Total Delete Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the DELETE method (counted since service startup). Delete requests are generally used for file removals.

webserviceDeleteRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceDeleteRequestsPerSec
webserviceDeleteRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using the DELETE method are made. Delete requests are generally used for file removals.

webserviceTotalTraceRequests.name: webserviceTotalTraceRequests
webserviceTotalTraceRequests.description: Total Trace Requests is the number of HTTP requests using the TRACE method (counted since service startup). Trace requests allow the client to see what is being received at the end of the request chain and use the information for diagnostic purposes.

webserviceTotalOtherRequestMethods.name: webserviceTotalOtherRequestMethods
webserviceTotalOtherRequestMethods.description: Total Other Request Methods is the number of HTTP requests that are not GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE or HEAD methods (counted since service startup). These may include LINK or other methods supported by gateway applications.

webserviceOtherRequestMethodsPerSec.name: webserviceOtherRequestMethodsPerSec
webserviceOtherRequestMethodsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests are made that do not use the GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE or HEAD methods. These may include LINK or other methods supported by gateway applications.

webserviceTotalMethodRequests.name: webserviceTotalMethodRequests
webserviceTotalMethodRequests.description: Total Method Requests is the number of HTTP GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE, HEAD and other method requests (counted since service startup).

webserviceTotalMethodRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceTotalMethodRequestsPerSec
webserviceTotalMethodRequestsPerSec.description: The rate HTTP requests using GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE or HEAD methods are made.

webserviceTotalCGIRequests.name: webserviceTotalCGIRequests
webserviceTotalCGIRequests.description: Total Common Gateway Interface (CGI) requests are custom gateway executables (.exe) the administrator can install to add forms processing or other dynamic data sources. CGI requests spawn a process on the server which can be a large drain on server resources. The count is the total since service startup.

webserviceCGIRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceCGIRequestsPerSec
webserviceCGIRequestsPerSec.description: The rate of CGI requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service.

webserviceTotalISAPIExtensionRequests.name: webserviceTotalISAPIExtensionRequests
webserviceTotalISAPIExtensionRequests.description: Total ISAPI Extension Requests are custom gateway Dynamic Link Libraries (.dll) the administrator can install to add forms processing or other dynamic data sources. Unlike CGI requests, ISAPI requests are simple calls to a DLL library routine, thus they are better suited to high performance gateway applications. The count is the total since service startup.

webserviceISAPIExtensionRequestsPerSec.name: webserviceISAPIExtensionRequestsPerSec
webserviceISAPIExtensionRequestsPerSec.description: The rate of ISAPI Extension requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service.

webserviceTotalNotFoundErrors.name: webserviceTotalNotFoundErrors
webserviceTotalNotFoundErrors.description: Total Not Found Errors is the number of requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document could not be found. These are generally reported as an HTTP 404 error code to the client. The count is the total since service startup.

webserviceNotFoundErrorsPerSec.name: webserviceNotFoundErrorsPerSec
webserviceNotFoundErrorsPerSec.description: The rate of errors due to requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document could not be found. These are generally reported as an HTTP 404 error code to the client.

webserviceCurrentCGIRequests.name: webserviceCurrentCGIRequests
webserviceCurrentCGIRequests.description: Current CGI Requests is the current number of CGI requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service.

webserviceCurrentISAPIExtensionRequests.name: webserviceCurrentISAPIExtensionRequests
webserviceCurrentISAPIExtensionRequests.description: Current ISAPI Extension Requests is the current number of Extension requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service.

webserviceMaximumCGIRequests.name: webserviceMaximumCGIRequests
webserviceMaximumCGIRequests.description: Maximum CGI Requests is the maximum number of CGI requests simultaneously processed by the Web service.

webserviceMaximumISAPIExtensionRequests.name: webserviceMaximumISAPIExtensionRequests
webserviceMaximumISAPIExtensionRequests.description: Maximum ISAPI Extension Requests is the maximum number of Extension requests simultaneously processed by the Web service.

webserviceTotalBlockedAsyncIPerORequests.name: webserviceTotalBlockedAsyncIPerORequests
webserviceTotalBlockedAsyncIPerORequests.description: Total requests temporarily blocked due to bandwidth throttling settings (counted since service startup).

webserviceTotalAllowedAsyncIPerORequests.name: webserviceTotalAllowedAsyncIPerORequests
webserviceTotalAllowedAsyncIPerORequests.description: Total requests allowed by bandwidth throttling settings (counted since service startup).

webserviceTotalRejectedAsyncIPerORequest.name: webserviceTotalRejectedAsyncIPerORequests
webserviceTotalRejectedAsyncIPerORequest.description: Total requests rejected due to bandwidth throttling settings (counted since service startup).

webserviceCurrentBlockedAsyncIPerOReques.name: webserviceCurrentBlockedAsyncIPerORequests
webserviceCurrentBlockedAsyncIPerOReques.description: Current requests temporarily blocked due to bandwidth throttling settings.
